meanings.definition: Not meeting the necessary requirements or standards.
meanings.sent1: She felt unqualified for the job because she lacked the needed experience.
meanings.sent2: The candidate was unqualified for the position due to a lack of qualifications.
meanings.sent3: It was unqualified how she managed to complete the task without proper training.
meanings.sent4: His unqualified attempt at fixing the car only made the problem worse.
meanings.sent5: The unqualified response left everyone confused about the solution.

meanings.sent1: The unqualified truth was finally revealed to the public.
meanings.sent2: Her unqualified dedication to her work earned her a promotion.
meanings.sent3: The unqualified silence in the room made everyone uneasy.
meanings.sent4: His unqualified love for music was evident in every note he played.
meanings.sent5: The unqualified darkness of the night enveloped the city in mystery.

meanings.sent1: The unqualified access to information allowed them to learn freely.
meanings.sent2: Her unqualified imagination knew no bounds when creating stories.
meanings.sent3: The unqualified space in the room made it perfect for a dance party.
meanings.sent4: His unqualified enthusiasm for the project inspired the whole team.
meanings.sent5: The unqualified possibilities of the future excited her beyond measure.
